case_vignette: A 20-year-old woman presents to the clinic with a circular hypopigmented lesion on her right cheek. The patient stated that she used to have a mole in the same location. Over time she noticed a white area around the mole that enlarged to the current size of the lesion. After a few months she noticed the mole in the center of the lesion had disappeared. On further questioning, she denies any personal or family history of skin cancer.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a circular, lighter colored patch on my right cheek where I used to have a mole.
Has the mole recently changed in size, shape, or color before turning into the lighter patch?
Yes, I noticed a white area forming around the mole before it completely disappeared and the light patch grew larger.
Do you have any similar patches elsewhere on your body?
No, I don't have similar patches elsewhere on my body.
Do you have a history of skin cancer in your family?
No, I do not have a family history of skin cancer.
Have you experienced any sensations like itching or pain in the affected area?
No, I haven't experienced any itching or pain in the affected area.
Have you been using any new skincare products or medications on your skin recently?
No, I haven't been using any new skincare products or medications on my skin recently.
Final Diagnosis: Halo Nevus.
